resources.string: "The ability to control fire was a dramatic change in the habits of early humans.What do you think, what was the impact? "
It enabled them to live in cooler climates.
It helped to keep nocturnal predators at bay.
To generate heat and light made it possible for people to cook food, simultaneously increasing the variety and availability of nutrients and reducing disease by killing organisms in the food.
It has also many other impacts.

"The concept of using steam to power machines had been around for thousands of years, but Thomas Newcomen's creation in 1712 was the first to harness that power for useful work (pumping water out of mines, for the most part). In 1769, a Scotish inventor modified a Newcomen engine by adding a separate condenser, which vastly increased the steam engine's power and made it a far more practical way to do work. Do you know the name of this Scotish inventor?"
